intro: Pectis uniaristata var. holostemma, commonly known as the narrowleaf pectis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a woody stem and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments.
